subsection.subsectiontext: A person must not construct a holding tank unless the person holds a permit issued under this section.
A person may apply for a permit to construct a holding tank by submitting to an inspector, in a form acceptable to the inspector,

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the person's name, address and telephone number,
the type of structure the holding tank will serve, and
any other information relevant to the holding tank or structure that the inspector requires,

paragraph.paragraphtext: a description of the holding tank, or of alterations or repairs to the holding tank,
the proposed maintenance plan for the holding tank, and

subsection.subsectiontext: On receiving an application under subsection (2), an inspector may

paragraph.paragraphtext: make an inspection to determine whether to issue a permit under paragraph (b), and
issue a permit to construct a holding tank only if satisfied that

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: a holding tank is adequate to deal with the domestic sewage originating from the structure, and
the use of the holding tank will not, if the maintenance plan is followed, cause, or contribute to, a health hazard.

subsection.subsectiontext: An inspector may attach any conditions to a permit that are necessary for the inspector to be satisfied of the matters listed under subsection (3).
If an inspector attaches conditions to a permit, the person who constructs the holding tank must comply with those conditions.

section.sectiontext: For the purpose of determining whether a holding tank or sewerage system is the cause of, or may be contributing to, a health hazard, an inspector may

paragraph.paragraphtext: inspect, in accordance with Division 1 of Part 4 [Inspections] of the Act,

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: the parcel on which the holding tank or sewerage system is located, and
any parcels that may be affected by the health hazard, and

paragraph.paragraphtext: order an owner, in accordance with Divisions 4 [Orders Respecting Health Hazards and Contraventions] and 5 [Making and Reviewing Orders] of Part 4 of the Act, to do one or more of the following:

subparagraph.subparagraphtext: connect a structure to a public sewer;
connect a structure to, in the inspector's discretion, a holding tank or sewerage system;
alter or repair a holding tank or sewerage system;
take any other action necessary to remedy the health hazard.
